contentrichtext.text: {{other uses}} In the [[Polynesian mythology|mythology]] of [[Mangaia]] in the Cook Islands, '''Moko''' is a wily character and grandfather of the heroic [[Ngaru]].<ref name ="Gill">*W.W. Gill, ''Myths and Songs from the South Pacific'' (H.S. King: London, 1876)</ref> Moko is a ruler or king of the [[lizard]]s, and he orders his lizard subjects to climb into the basket of the sky demon [[Amai-te-rangi]] to spy on him. When Amai-te-rangi pulls up his basket, he is disappointed to find it full of miserable little reptiles, which escape and overrun his home in the sky.<ref name ="Gill"/> ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Mangaia mythology]] [[de:Moko]]
